verses.verse: A Plea for Mercy (Ps 44.13-16; 89.50) Remember, O LORD, what has befallen us; look, and see our disgrace!
(Ps 79.1; Zeph 1.13) Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers, our homes to aliens.
We have become orphans, fatherless; our mothers are like widows.
We must pay for the water we drink; the wood we get must be bought.
(Neh 9.36, 37; Jer 28.14) With a yoke (Symmachus: Heb lacks With a yoke) on our necks we are hard driven; we are weary; we are given no rest.
(Jer 2.36; Hos 5.13; 7.11; 9.3) We have made a pact with (Heb have given the hand to) Egypt and Assyria to get enough bread.
(Jer 14.20) Our ancestors sinned; they are no more, and we bear their iniquities.
(Neh 5.15; Zech 11.6) Slaves rule over us; there is no one to deliver us from their hand.
We get our bread at the peril of our lives, because of the sword in the wilderness.
(Lam 4.8) Our skin is black as an oven from the scorching heat of famine.
(Isa 13.16; Zech 14.2) Women are raped in Zion, young women in the towns of Judah.
(Lam 4.16) Princes are hung up by their hands; no respect is shown to the elders.
(Jer 7.18) Young men are compelled to grind, and boys stagger under loads of wood.
The old men have left the city gate, the young men their music.
(Jer 25.10) The joy of our hearts has ceased; our dancing has been turned to mourning.
The crown has fallen from our head; woe to us, for we have sinned!
(Ps 6.7; Isa 1.5) Because of this our hearts are sick; because of these things our eyes have grown dim:
because of Mount Zion, which lies desolate; jackals prowl over it.
(Ps 9.7; 102.12, 25-27) But you, O LORD, reign forever; your throne endures to all generations.
(Ps 13.1) Why have you forgotten us completely? Why have you forsaken us these many days?
(Jer 31.18) Restore us to yourself, O LORD, that we may be restored; renew our days as of oldâ€”
(Isa 64.9; Jer 7.29) unless you have utterly rejected us and are angry with us beyond measure.
